record.description: View of the city of Nippur in Iraq, a site where archeologists from the University of Chicago and University of Pennsylvania discovered a large temple, one of two found in 1952 at the northwestern end of a forty-acre religious quarter. The temple is part of a complex of the early dynastic period (first half of the third millennium B.C.E.) believed to have been dedicated to En-lil and other gods.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
